p.s: I did a little bit of research on systematic racism in the USA and I found a very interesting article on race inequality published by Zeit Online.
The text is about the fact that segregation was abolished on paper more than 50 years ago but the divide between black and white is still very present in the USA.
Black people are not getting the same amount of education and are way more likely to be stopped and arrested by the police.
All this is still a problem after 50 years of on paper civil rights for all people.
And even if they get good education or by a very small chance even get a bachelor or master degree they are still more likely to not get a job.
And if you are a black perosn with master degree and a good job you are still more likely to get stopedstopped and frisked by the police.
And also way more black people live a life in poverty than white people.
Have you ever witnessed or experienced something like that or did you know that it is still that bad?
Or do you even think that segregation and social and racial inequality are not a thing anymore?
